subject: Test skipping logic for DB func unsupported by sqlite
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}, {'_account_id': 4491, 'name': 'Lianhao Lu', 'email': 'lianhao.lu@intel.com', 'username': 'lianhao-lu'}, {'_account_id': 7763, 'name': 'Alexei Kornienko', 'email': 'akornienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akornienko'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-03-01 18:10:12.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_statistics_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py', 'ceilometer/utils.py'], 'message': 'Test skipping logic for DB func unsupported by sqlite

Related-to: BP wider-aggregate-range

Certain DB functions required by the selectable aggregates
feature (e.g. stddev_pop) are not supported by sqlite.

In order to allow scenario tests exercising this functionality to
be run against mongodb in the normal case, or even against mysql,
we need to gracefully skip the test when run against sqlite.

This is achieved by means of a decorator applied to the
corresponding method on the sqlalchemy driver. The decorator
peeks ahead in the generator and maps exceptions matching some
criteria, allowing certain OperationalErrors to be mapped to
NotImplementedError, which in turn causes the test to be
skipped as required.

Change-Id: Ic755ac77070723ef009c1b3198d3869c737d9c45
'}]
commit_message:
Test skipping logic for DB func unsupported by sqlite

Related-to: BP wider-aggregate-range

Certain DB functions required by the selectable aggregates
feature (e.g. stddev_pop) are not supported by sqlite.

In order to allow scenario tests exercising this functionality to
be run against mongodb in the normal case, or even against mysql,
we need to gracefully skip the test when run against sqlite.

This is achieved by means of a decorator applied to the
corresponding method on the sqlalchemy driver. The decorator
peeks ahead in the generator and maps exceptions matching some
criteria, allowing certain OperationalErrors to be mapped to
NotImplementedError, which in turn causes the test to be
skipped as required.

Change-Id: Ic755ac77070723ef009c1b3198d3869c737d9c45

subject: Fix get project users when no user exists
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-03-01 16:16:56.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/assignment/controllers.py', 'keystone/tests/test_v2_controller.py'], 'message': "Fix get project users when no user exists

The server would respond with a 404 Not Found if the client
requested a list of the users with a role on the project and any
of the users didn't exist in the identity backend. The user may
not exist because the server doesn't enforce that users exist when
granting roles (because of federation, the users may not exist in
the identity backend).

It's inappropriate to respond with a 404 Not Found for the
/v2.0/tenants/{tenant_id}/users resource because the resource
actually does exist.

The server will now respond with a 200 OK and will just not include
users that don't exist.

bp no-check-id

Change-Id: Idf95836bf54470d91032d2c3ace970ca471cf25d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix get project users when no user exists

The server would respond with a 404 Not Found if the client
requested a list of the users with a role on the project and any
of the users didn't exist in the identity backend. The user may
not exist because the server doesn't enforce that users exist when
granting roles (because of federation, the users may not exist in
the identity backend).

It's inappropriate to respond with a 404 Not Found for the
/v2.0/tenants/{tenant_id}/users resource because the resource
actually does exist.

The server will now respond with a 200 OK and will just not include
users that don't exist.

bp no-check-id

Change-Id: Idf95836bf54470d91032d2c3ace970ca471cf25d

per cluster.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-01 16:43:45.000000000', 'files': ['autogenerate_config_docs/common.py'], 'message': "autogenerate_config_docs: fix computing of relative path

If the git repository path (-i flag) is the name of the project (nova/, glance/,
etc), then splitting the .py file path to get a relative path doesn't work as
expected. This patch limits the number of tokens generated to get the correct
behaviour.

Change-Id: I1df7eb875c8c025ef5f82f4102f00cd13b736aea
"}]
commit_message:
autogenerate_config_docs: fix computing of relative path

If the git repository path (-i flag) is the name of the project (nova/, glance/,
etc), then splitting the .py file path to get a relative path doesn't work as
expected. This patch limits the number of tokens generated to get the correct
behaviour.

Change-Id: I1df7eb875c8c025ef5f82f4102f00cd13b736aea

commit_message:
make ceilometer work if you don't enable ceilometer-api

when doing ceilometer in a multihost devstack, you don't want
ceilometer-api running on the computes. Under -o errexit this
became fatal.

Change-Id: Ie43c8724ba467b810f5a3b075dea45d66dde8648

with '-o errexit' should that, as in the common case,
the image has not been uploaded into Glance.

While we could workaround this using a '|| :', the existing
code also happened to overwrite the DOCKER_IMAGE global
which is used elsewhere. It seemed prudent to either change
this variable name or remove it altogether.

Finally, using 'glance image-show' is more deterministic
than grepping the output of 'glance image-list'.

Change-Id: I23188155966ae9db64259b4a9d25a0d98c63c912
Closes-Bug: 1286443
"}]
commit_message:
Use glance image-show to check for uploaded Docker images

The behavior of the code being replaced was failing
with '-o errexit' should that, as in the common case,
the image has not been uploaded into Glance.

While we could workaround this using a '|| :', the existing
code also happened to overwrite the DOCKER_IMAGE global
which is used elsewhere. It seemed prudent to either change
this variable name or remove it altogether.

Finally, using 'glance image-show' is more deterministic
than grepping the output of 'glance image-list'.

Change-Id: I23188155966ae9db64259b4a9d25a0d98c63c912
Closes-Bug: 1286443

commit_message:
Update the image name for RHEL Guest Image to be correct

The RHEL 6 Guest Image has been updated with a new release that
addresses a number of bugs.  The diskimage-builder element that
references this file needed to be updated to reference the correct
image name.  In addition, some notes to help users download the image
from RHN have been added to the README.

Change-Id: I7ccbc9a5f9014d9247ccceadee3c7d99b0cd37c3
Closes-bug: launchpad-bug-1286568

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7494, 'name': 'Guangya Liu', 'email': 'gyliu513@gmail.com', 'username': 'JayLau'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-27 05:58:02.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/scheduler/base_filter.py'], 'message': 'Use _LI instead of _ for info message translation

In patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/70455 , it was using _
for info message translation but not _LI, this is not correct.

In bp log-messages-translation-domain , we have made some changes
for message translation:
_LI(): info
_LW(): warn
_LE(): exception

This patch was update one info message in base_filter.py use _LI
for message translation.

Change-Id: I2d42c0a9950bf368d7359b9cad61d610b3b41c8f
'}]
commit_message:
Use _LI instead of _ for info message translation

In patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/70455 , it was using _
for info message translation but not _LI, this is not correct.

In bp log-messages-translation-domain , we have made some changes
for message translation:
_LI(): info
_LW(): warn
_LE(): exception

This patch was update one info message in base_filter.py use _LI
for message translation.

Change-Id: I2d42c0a9950bf368d7359b9cad61d610b3b41c8f

commit_message:
Language Pack DB schema and object model

Added Language Pack DB schema and object model.
Added tests for Language Pack schema.
Added language pack attributes.
(compiler_versions, language_impl and os_platform are added as columns,
other attributes are added as a json blob in the language_pack table.)
Added service.id as foreign key in language pack table.

Change-Id: I95aec95e47d2aa5662471122a553d916e5b0b4b3

commit_message:
Introduce Guru Meditation Reports into Nova

This commit integrates functionality from the
`openstack.common.report` module into Nova.
This enables Nova services to receive SIGUSR1
and print a Guru Meditation Report to stderr.
The required modules were added to
'openstack-common.conf' as well.

Change-Id: I224a426dad084f0e738069207ffbffe7f7935a17
Implements: blueprint guru-meditation-report

commit_message:
Do not use the '+' operation dict_items()

This operation is undefined in Python3, list() must be called first.

Change-Id: I07a9b81a117dfd38e04e1d92533522036f8b0f9f

commit_message:
Update apiclient.base and reuse new functional

Module apiclient.base has several updates in oslo, so we need to sync
latest code to have ability to reuse new functional.

Updates in oslo which related to usage of apiclient.base in heatclient:
- I491f9b54c7074546cf738c6150666bfcc3966a78
- I1db6c12a1f798de7f7fafd0c34fb0ef523610153

Related to bp common-client-library-2

Change-Id: I509d6efb0c8eef87ba2e4aa02ebb44ba149a9860

Currently firewall remains in status "ACTIVE" after admin state

commit_message:
Change firewall to DOWN when admin state down

Currently firewall remains in status "ACTIVE" after admin state
is changed to DOWN.

This fix sets firewall status to "DOWN" if admin state is updated
from "UP" to "DOWN". "DOWN" status is used by other network resources
so use "DOWN" to keep consistent.

Change-Id: If316b114c4df78368b43c2a15a820bb1177b3a54
Closes-Bug: 1279213

commit_message:
Add api tests for neutron router

Add tests for:
- Update router administrative state
- Add several interfaces (to different subnets) to a router
Add improvements for:
- When removing an interface, assert correct subnet id from the response
- When removing an interface, assert correct port id from the response

according to https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/icehouse-summit-qa-neutron

Change-Id: I538e8bed2f5c726ebd610d406702d4ef9de88723

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-28 08:51:15.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/impl_hbase.py'], 'message': 'Alarm support in HBase Part 1

Two additional tables are introduced for alarms and alarm_history.
Ordering in alarm_history was achived by that fact that HBase
stores entries in alphabetical order. It is needed to enlarge the
preciseness of reverse_timestamp because alarms history entries may be
generated once per second, especially in tests.

Partially implements bp hbase-alarming

Change-Id: I41bc60f13779899af0e8f8e01f85b2ee6d1c8aae
'}]
commit_message:
Alarm support in HBase Part 1

Two additional tables are introduced for alarms and alarm_history.
Ordering in alarm_history was achived by that fact that HBase
stores entries in alphabetical order. It is needed to enlarge the
preciseness of reverse_timestamp because alarms history entries may be
generated once per second, especially in tests.

Partially implements bp hbase-alarming

Change-Id: I41bc60f13779899af0e8f8e01f85b2ee6d1c8aae

commit_message:
nova changes for multinode working under -o errexit

There was a stray inicomment on paste outside of a nova-api block. This
fails under -o errexit because the paste.ini doesn't exist.

Move this to inside the correct block.

Sync from Oslo, change-id: I91289cc4a60f5dab89bca852e6f52b4b83831e47

When using PublishErrorsHandler, it will missing user-supplied
arguments. For example, do LOG.info("blabla %s", "foo"), the

Change-Id: I9e5515da31a04b82d49e406bc6b246f940fb73fc
'}]
commit_message:
Add user-supplied arguments in log_handler

Sync from Oslo, change-id: I91289cc4a60f5dab89bca852e6f52b4b83831e47

When using PublishErrorsHandler, it will missing user-supplied
arguments. For example, do LOG.info("blabla %s", "foo"), the
payload only contains "blabla %s", but we expect it like "blabla foo".

Change-Id: I9e5515da31a04b82d49e406bc6b246f940fb73fc

commit_message:
Deprecate conductor instance_type_get() and remove from VirtAPI

The flavor_get() in VirtAPI and instance_type_get() in conductor are
no longer needed by the virt drivers. This patch deprecates the
function in conductor's API and removes it everywhere else.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: I782ee449df98a198f625b946c650ebff56711b8e

commit_message:
Make compute manager use InstanceInfoCache object for deletes

This patch makes compute manager use the InstanceInfoCache object
that is already in the instance to delete the cache while deleting
the instance.

It also fixes two tests that were still passing non-object
instance dicts to the method, which wasn't reflective of reality.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: I829bd2d3828c01c18f3479375bea22e7f4be9d97

commit_message:
VMware: fix datastore selection when token is returned

Use the token returned by the PropertyCollector to iterate
over the complete set of datastores and select the best
match based on the regular expression and the free space on
the datastore.

Closes-Bug: #1245564
Change-Id: If24c37a41bfa994a990aaa4a3e21d16b33aad42f

commit_message:
use ensure_packages to install common-package

  - depreceate parameter package_ensure (not used anymore)
  - use ensure_package for common-package
  - fixes issue when common is installed for other services
    (see Change-Id: I91098bd3f13ee4391dcf1b870705c0a0c5566acc,
     where alarm_package is equal to common for ubuntu/debian
     in stable/havana branch)

Change-Id: I4bb2f54afc9fca21dc4734b09d7d853404a7ea7c

commit_message:
Make restore_instance pass the Instance object to compute manager

The compute/api code already receives and uses an object, but
converts it to a dict before sending it down. This plumbs the
instance object all the way through to the driver.

This also converts the old compute_api non-unity test to a
proper unit test in test_compute_api, per usual when converting
API calls to objects.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects
Related to blueprint virt-objects

Change-Id: Ic2d7d14c50d85556ed1170f7d026c9d84423c876

Assuming if the system does not have the xinetd.d/rsync,
the dedicated service is the prefered way.

commit_message:
Make EMC SMI-S driver unit tests faster.

Some of EMC SMI-S driver unit tests are very slow.
This patch uses a fake_sleep in unit tests to return right away.

Closes-Bug: #1285927

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-02-27 14:16:50.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/parser.py', 'heat/engine/api.py', 'heat/tests/test_parser.py', 'heat/api/cfn/v1/stacks.py', 'heat/tests/test_api_cfn_v1.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_engine_api_utils.py'], 'message': 'Change Stack timestamps to save correct info

Stack.updated_time is currently being treated as modification time of
the object in the database.  Since it's not a very useful thing to have
and the CFN API treats this value as "the last time an update call was
issued", it makes sense to have the same behavior here as well.

This changes the current real-time retrieval of created_time and
updated_time in favor of the attributes already present in the stack and
changes the information stored in these two fields to be the time the
stack was created and the time the stack was last updated by the user,
respectively.

Co-Authored-By: Anderson Mesquita <andersonvom@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1193269
Change-Id: I1fd6586b827b3f2babb5af5c85f9de25da74fbb6
'}]
commit_message:
Change Stack timestamps to save correct info

Stack.updated_time is currently being treated as modification time of
the object in the database.  Since it's not a very useful thing to have
and the CFN API treats this value as "the last time an update call was
issued", it makes sense to have the same behavior here as well.

This changes the current real-time retrieval of created_time and
updated_time in favor of the attributes already present in the stack and
changes the information stored in these two fields to be the time the
stack was created and the time the stack was last updated by the user,
respectively.

Co-Authored-By: Anderson Mesquita <andersonvom@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1193269
Change-Id: I1fd6586b827b3f2babb5af5c85f9de25da74fbb6

commit_message:
oauth1 extension migration fails with DB2

Running keystone-manage db_sync --extension oauth1 would fail when
using DB2 with an error that the REQUESTED_ROLES column isn't
defined on the REQUEST_TOKEN table.

This problem is worked around by dropping the NULL constraint
first and then renaming the column.

Change-Id: I58438cad4d645c553da5710455e8a219b8fd3014
Closes-Bug: #1284740

commit_message:
Implement V3 Specific Version of EC2 Contrib

Implement an EC2 Controller that returns a V3 token when invoked
via the V3 pipeline. Moved all code except the `authenticate` method
into a common base class mixin. `authenticate()` has become an
abstract method. Shared code from `authenticate()` was moved into
`_authenticate()`.

V3 specific router definition added that makes use of the new V3
specific controller.

For upgrade purposes:
* The paste.ini for keystone will need to be modified to include
  the new V3 ec2credentials in the pipeline as is documented in
  the updated sample paste.ini.
* Policy.json updated to provide rules for the new V3 EC2credential
  CRUD as show in the updated sample policy.json and
  policy.v3cloudsample.json

For authentication that occurs via the V3 ec2credential system,
the response auth_method (encoded in the token) will be
"ec2credential". This should have no impact on using
or consuming the token itself but can be used to identify if
the token was issued via the Ec2ControllerV3.authenticate
method.

The V2 version of ec2credential controller has been marked
as deprecated to keep in line with the rest of the V2 API
being deprecated (slated for removal in K).

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: Iaf1e05a1beef481385c6eb19d7f54cdc84b5b5df
Closes-Bug: #1269947
bp: deprecated-as-of-icehouse

subject: Use uuid instead of name for lvm backend
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 4912, 'name': 'Michael H Wilson', 'email': 'geekinutah@gmail.com', 'username': 'geekinutah'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-02-28 20:48:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': 'Use uuid instead of name for lvm backend

Because libvirt lvm volumes are based on instance['name'], it means
that the actual names used in lvm storage are based on an operator
configuration variable: instance_name_template (default is
'instance-%08x').

However this is site changeable, and changeable at any time. This
creates 2 failure modes.

1. Operator changes this, the result is all volumes created before the
change are no longer able to be cleaned up by nova

2. Operator has changed this to something that includes end user
input, like %(display_name), which would allow one user to impact
another (user A has display name "bob", user B has display name
"bob_joe")

This changes the lvm backend to use instance['uuid'] as it's
identifier which we know is unique, non overlapping, and not
changeable based on whims of site policy.

It also provides limited backwards compatibility for cleaning up old
disks if the installation was using the default template (which is
safe), otherwise it logs a warning about possibly leaking a disk which
will need to be manually cleaned up. That should be removed once we
open the Juno tree.

UpgradeImpact - while there is no operator action required to upgrade
over this change, if the nova install included a non default value for
instance_name_template then old lvm volumes will need to be cleaned up
manually after old guests are destroyed.

Change-Id: Ib36b962971fd1f66ea9a0818e91fec59e118e686
Closes-Bug: #1285735
'}]
commit_message:
Use uuid instead of name for lvm backend

Because libvirt lvm volumes are based on instance['name'], it means
that the actual names used in lvm storage are based on an operator
configuration variable: instance_name_template (default is
'instance-%08x').

However this is site changeable, and changeable at any time. This
creates 2 failure modes.

1. Operator changes this, the result is all volumes created before the
change are no longer able to be cleaned up by nova

2. Operator has changed this to something that includes end user
input, like %(display_name), which would allow one user to impact
another (user A has display name "bob", user B has display name
"bob_joe")

This changes the lvm backend to use instance['uuid'] as it's
identifier which we know is unique, non overlapping, and not
changeable based on whims of site policy.

It also provides limited backwards compatibility for cleaning up old
disks if the installation was using the default template (which is
safe), otherwise it logs a warning about possibly leaking a disk which
will need to be manually cleaned up. That should be removed once we
open the Juno tree.

UpgradeImpact - while there is no operator action required to upgrade
over this change, if the nova install included a non default value for
instance_name_template then old lvm volumes will need to be cleaned up
manually after old guests are destroyed.

Change-Id: Ib36b962971fd1f66ea9a0818e91fec59e118e686
Closes-Bug: #1285735

commit_message:
Integration tests - running the tests

Initial setup for running the integration tests. A basic test is
included to ensure this works, although it will be rewritten to follow
the Page Object pattern. Thanks to Daniel Korn for the initial test.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Horizon/Testing/UI

Implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

commit_message:
Make the metadata namespace proxy transparent

Refactor the namespace proxy to make it transparent for all http requests
and responses that pass through, so that they are forwarded as if they were made
by their original source. This will allow us to support any upcoming changes
in the metadata service with minimal changes from the Neutron part.

Closes-Bug: #1175955
Change-Id: Iedf3ebb86e342bd8699fca45fc2a934d2ea31730

commit_message:
Add missing ComputeNode fields

host_ip, supported_instances, pci_stats, and extra_resources were
missing from the ComputeNode object. Also, the 'stats' entry needs
to support all primitives as values, not just strings.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: I4b45574a8bee0c9ad1c014b13db312c3ab618950

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-21 06:25:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/loadbalancer/drivers/haproxy/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/loadbalancer/drivers/haproxy/test_agent.py', 'neutron/services/loadbalancer/drivers/haproxy/agent_manager.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/loadbalancer/drivers/haproxy/test_agent_manager.py'], 'message': "lbaas/haproxy/agent: use neutron.service instead of rpc.service

lbaas haproxy agent defines periodic_interval option in DEFAULT group
which is inconsistent the same option defined by other agents/servers.
The inconsistency causes a confusion.  Since even major distro
document misses this difference, almost all the admins can't
understand it.
  default value: 10(haproxy) vs 40(others)
  behaviour: neutron.openstack.common.rpc.service.Service.threadgroup(haproxy)
             vs neutron.service.Service(others)

So make haproxy agent use neutron.service instead of
neutron.openstack.common.rpc.service and eliminate haproxy agent specific
definition.

Closes-Bug: #1282483
Change-Id: I0e079f8474bb088c22f99e7fa5e9bb205fd0d13a
"}]
commit_message:
lbaas/haproxy/agent: use neutron.service instead of rpc.service

lbaas haproxy agent defines periodic_interval option in DEFAULT group
which is inconsistent the same option defined by other agents/servers.
The inconsistency causes a confusion.  Since even major distro
document misses this difference, almost all the admins can't
understand it.
  default value: 10(haproxy) vs 40(others)
  behaviour: neutron.openstack.common.rpc.service.Service.threadgroup(haproxy)
             vs neutron.service.Service(others)

So make haproxy agent use neutron.service instead of
neutron.openstack.common.rpc.service and eliminate haproxy agent specific
definition.

Closes-Bug: #1282483
Change-Id: I0e079f8474bb088c22f99e7fa5e9bb205fd0d13a

commit_message:
grep may be fooled in aggregate.sh

In exit_if_aggregate_present function, we first 'nova aggregate-list',
grep output for aggregate_name variable.

The grep may be fooled, if the previous command has failed.

Change-Id: I728ebce6718e08dddb0a3550d4d05cfa692c87f5

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-19 17:40:49.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/rackspace/tests/test_rackspace_clients.py'], 'message': 'Oslo config option changed by test causing problem

When running this test via tox, non-deterministically tests will fail
because the cloud backend gets changed, which will cause pyrax to get
imported. By setting the config option back to normal after the test
we avoid this error.

Change-Id: I28194a223883cde1884b1b0e8a810bc3e9d4c2f2
'}]
commit_message:
Oslo config option changed by test causing problem

When running this test via tox, non-deterministically tests will fail
because the cloud backend gets changed, which will cause pyrax to get
imported. By setting the config option back to normal after the test
we avoid this error.

Change-Id: I28194a223883cde1884b1b0e8a810bc3e9d4c2f2

commit_message:
Support multiple active scheduler policies/configurations

Allows maintaining multiple active scheduler policies/configurations
within a single Nova deployment.
Policy/configuration is selected based on availability zone (more
options to be supported later).
Scheduler parameters (filters, options, etc) are overridden
based on selected policy configuration.

Partially implements blueprint multiple-scheduler-drivers

DocImpact

Change-Id: I63109110f373324e7e81841f42a6cb21127c3386

subject: VMware: Fix vim logout during GC of VMwareAPISession
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 7575, 'name': 'Sabari', 'email': 'smurugesan@vmware.com', 'username': 'sabari'}, {'_account_id': 7629, 'name': 'Shawn Hartsock', 'email': 'hartsock@acm.org', 'username': 'hartsocks'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9555, 'name': 'Matthew Booth', 'email': 'mbooth@redhat.com', 'username': 'MatthewBooth'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-02-03 17:01:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py'], 'message': "VMware: Fix vim logout during GC of VMwareAPISession

VMwareAPISession.__del__ was doing:

  if hasattr(self, 'vim') and self.vim:
      self.vim.Logout(self.vim.get_service_content().sessionManager)

The check 'self.vim' is translated by python in the first instance
into a call to self.vim.__nonzero__(). However, Vim implements
__getattr__, so this was being translated into a call to
vim_request_handler(). This raised an exception because it was called
with an incorrect number of arguments. Consequently, the line
self.vim.Logout(...) was never called.

Closes-bug: #1275773
Change-Id: I04672db565f4f5fb38923990fead5e79b433628f
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Fix vim logout during GC of VMwareAPISession

VMwareAPISession.__del__ was doing:

  if hasattr(self, 'vim') and self.vim:
      self.vim.Logout(self.vim.get_service_content().sessionManager)

The check 'self.vim' is translated by python in the first instance
into a call to self.vim.__nonzero__(). However, Vim implements
__getattr__, so this was being translated into a call to
vim_request_handler(). This raised an exception because it was called
with an incorrect number of arguments. Consequently, the line
self.vim.Logout(...) was never called.

Closes-bug: #1275773
Change-Id: I04672db565f4f5fb38923990fead5e79b433628f

commit_message:
Remove db layer policy checks for pci

This patch removes policy checks in db layer for pci,
and related unittests. The checks was already in pci
api v3, the v2 pci patches are under review, we also
add the policy checks into the new patches. So the
checks in db layer can be removed.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: Icbcd960fe6b48f41d0ddef7bc243329e1ee2440f

commit_message:
Added keystone token cleanup script

pt-archiver script will run on a cron task
to purge tokens from keystone tokens table
periodically to prevent the database from
growing too large.

Added necessary dependencies for
installation on Red Hat.

Change-Id: Ic3aa5489069f8fdbc9a251eaaac7f90a805db1ea
Closes-Bug: 1274756

commit_message:
Merges config_drive into servers core for V3 API

As discussed at the icehouse mid cycle meetup, merge the
config drive extension into the servers core for the V3 API.
This functionality is now widely supported and considered fundamental
to all hypervisors for Nova.

Note that there is no longer any support in V3 API for policy control
of whether config drive information is returned.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I2210cecca81f4a7a923cd6f12aba8e8f5aab0e63

commit_message:
Move policy check of compute:get_console_output to api layer

This patch moves "get_console_output" to api layer for nova api v2, and uses
"compute_extension:v3:console-output:get_console_output" for v3 api. Also removes
policy check from compute api and add related tests.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: Id5e0a2016b12b41877cf18a69fc2001df6d671fa

commit_message:
Move policy check of rebuild/create_image to api layer

This patch moves "compute:rebuild/snapshot" to api layer for ec2 and nova
api v2, and uses "compute:v3:servers:rebuild/create_image" for nova api v3.
Also removes policy check from compute api. And give default rules
for v3 policy check.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: I37a6b3548cd3f9a070f43cae8f2f79effd18eb8f

commit_message:
Move policy check of create into api layer

This patch moves 'compute:create', 'compute:create:attach_network',
'compute:create:attach_volume' into api layer. v2 and ec2 api will
keep the same name. v3 api will use 'compute:v3:servers' as the scope
of policy.

For 'compute:create:attach_volume', it moves into block-device-mapping
extension. For support that, adds request context as the params for
server extension point.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic40a74088fc2fc88ef963ba2f9ac05bea0681c91

commit_message:
Move policy check of set_admin_password to api layer

This patch moves check of set_admin_password to api layer,
adds "compute:set_admin_password" for nova api v2 and uses
"compute_extension:v3:os-admin-password" for nova api v3.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

commit_message:
Remove db layer policy checks for cell

This patch removes policy checks in db layer for cell.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

UpgradeImpact: There is no longer a secondary check in the db layer
and the policy specified for "compute_extension:cells" is the
only restriction for v2 api. If the policy has changed to empty, it need
update to "compute_extension:cells": "rule:admin_api" at aleast.

Change-Id: I70c9eb8d248c54557bc3de3e8bca71cea02b7e82

commit_message:
Move policy check of get into API layer

This patch move policy 'compute:get' into api layer
for ec2 and nova v2 api. And use 'compute:v3:servers:show'
for v3 api.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic5d98c1019143cea91c825ee445ea6f206775060

commit_message:
Move policy check of attach_interface/detach_interface to api layer

This patch moves "compute:attach_interface/detach_interface" to api layer
nova api v2, and uses "compute_extension:v3:os-attach-interfaces:create/delete"
and separated authroize for each actions for v3 api. Also removes policy check
from compute api. Add related tests and fix some nit in test_attach_interfaces.py.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I6620542c86005cc128d5948655ba2d16a9d37196

cliff-tablib is needed only in test-requirements.txt but current unit
test code doesn't need it widely. If we keep it on the list of
test-requirements.txt, it only blocks the py33 virtual enviroment setup,

commit_message:
Remove cliff-tablib from test-requirements

cliff-tablib is needed only in test-requirements.txt but current unit
test code doesn't need it widely. If we keep it on the list of
test-requirements.txt, it only blocks the py33 virtual enviroment setup,
which is caused by the out-dated tablib module doesn't support python 3.

This patch removes the cliff-tablib and fixes the corresponding problem
of '-f json' to support py33 unit test, note that '-f json' needs
cliff-tablib for json formatter support, and this is the only part
cliff-tablib is needed.

Note that this patch only aims at enabling py33 virtual environment
setup, there are still lots of import errors block py33 unit test, which
will be fixed in other patches.

Implements: blueprint py33-support
Change-Id: If085f64c573f4b9f004962e3c0d90c451f93263e

commit_message:
Change the scope of update's policy to compute:v3:servers:update v3

For distinguishing core and extension api. core api will use
'compute:v3' as the scope of policy. This patch change it for
server's update.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

commit_message:
Move policy check of reboot to api layer

This patch moves "compute:reboot" to api layer for ec2 and nova
api v2, and uses "compute:v3:servers:reboot" for nova api v3.
Also removes policy check from compute api. And give default rules
for v3 policy check.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: I3a828b243cec4ab9f5bfe352abd5ccfb54b4a65a

commit_message:
Remove db layer policy checks for migration

This patch removes policy checks in db layer for migration,
and related unittest.

Also remove elevated context when invoke migration db, that needless
anymore.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

UpgradeImpact: There is no longer a secondary check in the db layer
and the policy specified for "compute_extension:migrations:index" is the
only restriction for v2 api. If the policy has changed to empty, it need
update to "compute_extension:migrations:index": "rule:admin_api" at aleast.

Change-Id: I64ae3823a151f3ae32cfa614cefc29cf4abfa4a8

commit_message:
Remove db layer authorization for certificates

This patches remove db layer authorization for certificates.
For v2 api, the default policy rule is empty, so add admin
authorization in v2 api layer for keep default behavior.

For v3 api, use policy rule to ensure the request is admin.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact
UpgradeImpact: There is no longer a secondary check in the db layer
and the policy specified for compute_extension:certificates is the
only restriction. The default policy rule need update to:
"compute_extension:certificates": "rule:admin_api"

Change-Id: I014d2d5562bcf097168a2502a20c602b64c033d4

commit_message:
Remove db layer authorize for keypair

In db layer, keypair will authorize the user id. But the user id
is aways same with request context's user id. So this authorize
didn't have any effect. This patch just removes those authorize.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: Id19c7d1b325e1f530c51b6473c5cbdbe062baf9d

commit_message:
Move quota-sets db layer policy checks into api layer

This patch removes db layer policy checks for quota-sets. For v3
api, add policy scope "compute_extension:v3:os-quota-sets:user_quota"
for user quota. For v2 api, it just keep compatibility.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

UpgradeImpact: There is no longer a secondary check in the db layer
and the policy specified for compute_extension:quotas/update/delete
is the only restriction for v2 api. If the default policy rule has
changed, it need update to:
"compute_extension:update/delete": "rule:admin_api"

Change-Id: Id14d13f20556f74004a9971ee66b6ac204ca4623

commit_message:
Move policy check of delete to api layer

This patch moves "compute:delete" to api layer for ec2 and nova
api v2, and uses "compute:v3:servers:delete" for nova api v3.
Also removes policy check from compute api. And give default rules
for v3 policy check.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib9a8bd7e7fc478a26a2b488f64b8276e95a528fe

commit_message:
Not use legacy block device mapping when rebuild

Currently when rebuild instance, the bdms are created with
legacy format and cause issue for re-attach the bdm.

Change it to not use legacy block device mapping.

Closes-bug: 1278533

Change-Id: Ic96419a1bd8e66317cdf34701996a0650f6c7c62
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Adds a new filter to implement project isolation feature

If an aggregate contains 'project_to_aggregate' as a metadata key,
then instances for those specified projects can only be created on hosts
which are part of that aggregate.
If a project is not attached to any specific aggregate, it is free to
create instances on any hosts.

Implements: blueprint projects-to-aggregate filter
Reference Link : https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/projects-to-aggregate

Change-Id: I8bbcc3aa35b9a16fac8e3beeb4c8f61364272555

This patch introduce the use of apache::vhost instead of
Apache configuration file produced from template.

This methods has two advantages:
- apache class stops thinking its files have been changed and do not
  trigger a full reload of the httpd service
- the ability to maintain different vhost on the same apache
- simplicity, espcially regarding SSL

It also avoid the use of 0.0.0.0 as bind IP since it prevents the
use of IPv6.

This patch doesn't fix any blocker bugs and introduces a lot of experimental
changes that will raise questions. The patch will probably be refactored.
I39b52b2bc51ba04d59de81dc45b5a4ad82d0dc2c is similar but already have
a consensus and fix a bug .
That's the reason why I prefer to not merge them but only to depend on the
first one.

Change-Id: Ie4f516270cb99144e1b930097cd5b1207f287626
"}]
commit_message:
introduce apache:vhost::wsgi class

This patch introduce the use of apache::vhost instead of
Apache configuration file produced from template.

This methods has two advantages:
- apache class stops thinking its files have been changed and do not
  trigger a full reload of the httpd service
- the ability to maintain different vhost on the same apache
- simplicity, espcially regarding SSL

It also avoid the use of 0.0.0.0 as bind IP since it prevents the
use of IPv6.

This patch doesn't fix any blocker bugs and introduces a lot of experimental
changes that will raise questions. The patch will probably be refactored.
I39b52b2bc51ba04d59de81dc45b5a4ad82d0dc2c is similar but already have
a consensus and fix a bug .
That's the reason why I prefer to not merge them but only to depend on the
first one.

Change-Id: Ie4f516270cb99144e1b930097cd5b1207f287626

commit_message:
Use oslo-common's logging fixture

Make the unit tests raise an exception when there is a logging
formatting issue. Related to oslo BP

Add use_syslog to Marconi config

This patch adds use_syslog option to the marconi config file. This
is needed to allow marconi to run, when USE_SCREEN is set to False
in devstack.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-28 21:57:44.000000000', 'files': ['congress/policy/tests/test_runtime.py', 'congress/policy/runtime.py'], 'message': 'Added rule body reordering for safety

Previously, we assumed the user would order rule bodies to ensure
that negative literals always occurred after all their vars were
bound.

This change moves all the negative literals to the end of each rule.
It is not even smart enough to check whether there is a need to
change the ordering.  Will need to be revised once performance becomes
an issue.

Change-Id: Idae20e23abc70307fcfba5d11b1a5958d4ab05bc
'}]
commit_message:
Added rule body reordering for safety

Previously, we assumed the user would order rule bodies to ensure
that negative literals always occurred after all their vars were
bound.

This change moves all the negative literals to the end of each rule.
It is not even smart enough to check whether there is a need to
change the ordering.  Will need to be revised once performance becomes
an issue.

Change-Id: Idae20e23abc70307fcfba5d11b1a5958d4ab05bc

commit_message:
Support authentication via SAML 2.0 assertions

This patch will support authentication via SAML 2.0 assertions.
A new authentication plugin will allow external users to authenticate
with keystone, provided the incoming assertion is valid.

The file keystone/contrib/federation/controllers.py was extended with two
new controllers.V3Controller classes:

*) DomainV3 which handles /v3/OS-FEDERATION/domains API call and returns
   list of domains a user can access based on the provided list of groups.

*) ProjectV3 which handles /v3/OS-FEDERATION/projects API call and returns
   list of project a user can access based on the provided list of groups.

Change-Id: I89f70e3a24e825e21580772c088c6fd5c44f3b63
Implements: blueprint saml-id

commit_message:
Add jasmine testing and helpers

    With the integration of the AngularJS framework we need a powerfull
testing, Jasmine could be a good choices because of its great features
and it is the one which is described into angularjs documentation. It
will allow us to have good example for creating our tests.

    To create a test you just have to inherit JasmineTests class, and
specify the tests files to run (with their path) in the specs class
attribute. If some html elements are needed, just inherit from the
jasmine.html template and add them to the content block, to finish
specify the template in the test class into the template_name attribute.

Implements: blueprint jasmine-integration
Change-Id: Ic39d3a4f097de045d1c789052ff4e43eb0ebde7e

subject: Proper fix for test_run_scenario_exception_inside_test
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 10165, 'name': 'Marco Morais', 'email': 'mmorais@yahoo-inc.com', 'username': 'mmorais'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-01 02:03:21.000000000', 'files': ['rally/benchmark/runners/continuous.py', 'tests/benchmark/test_runner.py'], 'message': 'Proper fix for test_run_scenario_exception_inside_test

We were getting non deterministic bugs in this method. But adding
more time like here  I1007436736bf9d42b98c8782a6141203c271aa75 is
not a proper way.

If we change order of check duration & running method we will be able
to run it exactly one time, even if we set duration == 0.

So it will raise exception => we will be able to check that is raised.

Change-Id: I64964f8386a06f0a54e134d62a59e0955e3a8d75
Closes-bug: #1283372
'}]
commit_message:
Proper fix for test_run_scenario_exception_inside_test

We were getting non deterministic bugs in this method. But adding
more time like here  I1007436736bf9d42b98c8782a6141203c271aa75 is
not a proper way.

If we change order of check duration & running method we will be able
to run it exactly one time, even if we set duration == 0.

So it will raise exception => we will be able to check that is raised.

Change-Id: I64964f8386a06f0a54e134d62a59e0955e3a8d75
Closes-bug: #1283372

commit_message:
Add pack_action_start/finish helper to InstanceAction object

Add these two helper function to cut InstanceAction object's dependency
on compute/utils.py. This is a refactor change so that
pack_action_start/finish code in compute/utils.py can be removed in a
later change.

The version of InstanceAction object doesn't change, since it's just an
object internal refactoring. No object field or method has been changed.

This is a part of: blueprint make-instance-action-use-objects

Change-Id: I38bde7b057efa0ce5634941f4ffa5ef27123958c

commit_message:
Ensure ovsdb-client is stopped when OVS agent dies

If the OVS agent is killed, the interpreter is killed before any cleanup
is done. This patch adds a signal handler for SIGTERM that exits
normally so that the existing cleanup is done and the ovsdb-client
process is terminated.

Change-Id: Ie4f8ff434098100f4699124403d58caa784084cf

commit_message:
Prevent a node in maintenance from being deployed

Prevent a node which is in maintenance mode from being deployed, other
operations like enabling/disabling the console and changing the power
state of the node should still be allowed.

Change-Id: I3b0139638816d1cbf909516b4e584f92bc89e88b

commit_message:
Allow clients to mark a node as in maintenance

Before the maintenance attribute was treated as an internal one, but it's
not, users should be able to mark a node as in maintenance. So this patch
is removing the maintenance attribute from the internal attributes list.

Change-Id: I35cbca53b7a0c253d2880bb7d350f70d5b4103a4

commit_message:
Add option to sync node power state from DB

Previously, during _sync_node_power_state, when a node's power state did
not match the expected state, the DB was always updated and a warning
logged.

This patch causes the node's power state to instead be set to the
expected value, by default, and adds a CONF option to enable the old
behavior.

Implements bp:keep-powered-off-nodes-off

Co-Authored-By: Michael Davies <michael@the-davies.net>
Change-Id: I1f5af0061dbe8c57b8bd3f8a65b215aadd549551

commit_message:
Use pretty tox with the ``all`` env

The all entry is usable for running custom set of test
cases selected by a regexp in similar venv
as the gate uses with tox -eall.

The pretty tox helps you to see some basic results before,
 the test suite finished.

Change-Id: I553e450ad0a59308be0bfa24aa66877cdb6667da

subject: Fix in in novaclient, to avoid excessive conns
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 2455, 'name': 'Tihomir Trifonov', 'email': 't.trifonov@gmail.com', 'username': 'ttrifonov'}, {'_account_id': 4264, 'name': 'Matthias Runge', 'email': 'mrunge@redhat.com', 'username': 'mrunge'}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-02-27 14:21:38.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/client.py'], 'message': "Fix in in novaclient, to avoid excessive conns

The current client creates new .Session() on each request,
but since Horizon is a stateless app, each Session creates
new HttpAdapter, which itself has its own connection pool,
and each connection there is used (almost) once and then
is being kept in the pool(with Keep-Alive) for a certain
amount of time(waiting for inactivity timeout). The problem
is that the connection cannot be used anymore from next Django
calls - they create new connection pool with new connections, etc.
This keeps lots of open connections on the server.

Now the client will store an HTTPAdapter for each URL into
a singleton object, and will reuse its connections between
Django calls, but still taking advantage of Sessions during
a single page load(although we do not fully use this).

Note: the default pool behavior is non-blocking, which means
that if the max_pool_size is reached, a new connection will
still be opened, and when released - will be discarded.
It could be useful to add max_pool_size param into settings,
for performance fine-tuning. The default max_pool_size is 10.

Since python-novaclient is also used from non-Django projects,
I'd expect feedback from more people on the impact this change
could have over other projects.

Patch Set 3: Removed explicit connection closing, leaving
connections open in the pool.

Change-Id: Icc9dc2fa2863d0e0e26a86c8180f2e0fbcd1fcff
Closes-Bug: #1247056
"}]
commit_message:
Fix in in novaclient, to avoid excessive conns

The current client creates new .Session() on each request,
but since Horizon is a stateless app, each Session creates
new HttpAdapter, which itself has its own connection pool,
and each connection there is used (almost) once and then
is being kept in the pool(with Keep-Alive) for a certain
amount of time(waiting for inactivity timeout). The problem
is that the connection cannot be used anymore from next Django
calls - they create new connection pool with new connections, etc.
This keeps lots of open connections on the server.

Now the client will store an HTTPAdapter for each URL into
a singleton object, and will reuse its connections between
Django calls, but still taking advantage of Sessions during
a single page load(although we do not fully use this).

Note: the default pool behavior is non-blocking, which means
that if the max_pool_size is reached, a new connection will
still be opened, and when released - will be discarded.
It could be useful to add max_pool_size param into settings,
for performance fine-tuning. The default max_pool_size is 10.

Since python-novaclient is also used from non-Django projects,
I'd expect feedback from more people on the impact this change
could have over other projects.

Patch Set 3: Removed explicit connection closing, leaving
connections open in the pool.

Change-Id: Icc9dc2fa2863d0e0e26a86c8180f2e0fbcd1fcff
Closes-Bug: #1247056

commit_message:
Refactor UUID test

Oslo is removing uuidutils during the icehouse cycle. We had removed
uuidutils.generate_uuid() in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60643/
It seems the UUID test was not executed, for example, there is no method
called generate_uuid() in common/utils, the Jekins still passed. This
patch move the testcase and remove the test method for generate_uuid.

Change-Id: If4f508129f0b44d63fe77ed1251c0e0737e7e897
Partial-Bug: #1253497

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}, {'_account_id': 2860, 'name': 'litong01', 'email': 'email4tong@yahoo.com', 'username': 'litong01'}, {'_account_id': 4491, 'name': 'Lianhao Lu', 'email': 'lianhao.lu@intel.com', 'username': 'lianhao-lu'}, {'_account_id': 6230, 'name': 'Rob Raymond', 'email': 'rob.raymond@hp.com', 'username': 'rob-raymond'}, {'_account_id': 9684, 'name': 'Jia Dong', 'email': 'joey5566@yeah.net', 'username': 'joey5678'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-02-26 15:46:22.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/compute/pollsters/test_diskio.py', 'ceilometer/compute/manager.py', 'ceilometer/tests/compute/pollsters/test_instance.py', 'ceilometer/compute/discovery.py', 'ceilometer/central/manager.py', 'ceilometer/compute/pollsters/disk.py', 'ceilometer/compute/plugin.py', 'ceilometer/compute/pollsters/cpu.py', 'ceilometer/compute/pollsters/instance.py', 'ceilometer/tests/compute/test_manager.py', 'ceilometer/tests/agentbase.py', 'ceilometer/tests/central/test_manager.py', 'ceilometer/tests/compute/pollsters/test_cpu.py', 'ceilometer/agent.py', 'ceilometer/tests/compute/pollsters/test_net.py', 'ceilometer/plugin.py', 'setup.cfg', 'ceilometer/compute/pollsters/net.py'], 'message': "Pluggable resource discovery for agents

Precursor-to: BP decoupled-source-sink-discoverable-resources

Add the concept of per-AgentManager resource discovery extensions
loaded via stevedore entry points. The extensions are loaded from
a single namespace:

  ceilometer.discover

shared by all agents. An agent may have a list of per-agent default
discovery extensions associated with it on creation. This is used
by the compute agent, which currently uses a single discovery extension
for all matching pipelines.

The per-pipeline statically configured resources remain in place to
potentially override the per-agent discovered resources - these will
be augmented by per-pipeline discovery in a subsequent patch.

Recast the compute agent's interrogation of the nova servers API
in the form of a discovery extension.

Unify the pollster abstraction used by the central and compute
agents (which had previously diverged along with the introduction
of per-pipeline resources).

Unify the polling task logic used by the central and compute
agents (so that the compute agent now iterates over each pollster
for all local instances, as opposed to interating over all
pollsters for each local instance).

Change-Id: I625df47231a1dbf7ef721c297701799b224ce67e
"}]
commit_message:
Pluggable resource discovery for agents

Precursor-to: BP decoupled-source-sink-discoverable-resources

Add the concept of per-AgentManager resource discovery extensions
loaded via stevedore entry points. The extensions are loaded from
a single namespace:

  ceilometer.discover

shared by all agents. An agent may have a list of per-agent default
discovery extensions associated with it on creation. This is used
by the compute agent, which currently uses a single discovery extension
for all matching pipelines.

The per-pipeline statically configured resources remain in place to
potentially override the per-agent discovered resources - these will
be augmented by per-pipeline discovery in a subsequent patch.

Recast the compute agent's interrogation of the nova servers API
in the form of a discovery extension.

Unify the pollster abstraction used by the central and compute
agents (which had previously diverged along with the introduction
of per-pipeline resources).

Unify the polling task logic used by the central and compute
agents (so that the compute agent now iterates over each pollster
for all local instances, as opposed to interating over all
pollsters for each local instance).

Change-Id: I625df47231a1dbf7ef721c297701799b224ce67e

subject: Preinstall yum-utils; move sudo check before install
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-28 00:26:25.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': "Preinstall yum-utils; move sudo check before install

Some cloud images don't have yum-utils installed, so the call to
yum-config-manager fails.  Pre-install it (I still think it's easier
than fiddling config files).

Also, these repo setup steps are using sudo, but the root/sudo checks
happen after this.  Move them up before we start trying to do
repo/package installs.

Change-Id: I875e1f0663c9badc00278b2cc1a3b04ca3dde9fc
"}]
commit_message:
Preinstall yum-utils; move sudo check before install

Some cloud images don't have yum-utils installed, so the call to
yum-config-manager fails.  Pre-install it (I still think it's easier
than fiddling config files).

Also, these repo setup steps are using sudo, but the root/sudo checks
happen after this.  Move them up before we start trying to do
repo/package installs.

Change-Id: I875e1f0663c9badc00278b2cc1a3b04ca3dde9fc

subject: Log deploy_utils.deploy() erros in the PXE driver
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-28 10:16:02.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py'], 'message': "Log deploy_utils.deploy() erros in the PXE driver

When the PXE driver invoke deploy_utils.deploy() it wasn't logging the
exceptions raised by this call. There was a comment saying that it was
being logged within the deploy() method itself, but it wasn't true for
all the exceptions it could raise, also, some of errors e.g TypeError
where not all parameters are being passed to the deploy() function can't
be logging by the function called itself and would fail silently. So
this patch is adding a log in the PXE module to fix this problem.

Change-Id: Ifbbc0f3cbd5c280d04249cee811d1dc478548975
Closes-Bug: #1286053
"}]
commit_message:
Log deploy_utils.deploy() erros in the PXE driver

When the PXE driver invoke deploy_utils.deploy() it wasn't logging the
exceptions raised by this call. There was a comment saying that it was
being logged within the deploy() method itself, but it wasn't true for
all the exceptions it could raise, also, some of errors e.g TypeError
where not all parameters are being passed to the deploy() function can't
be logging by the function called itself and would fail silently. So
this patch is adding a log in the PXE module to fix this problem.

Change-Id: Ifbbc0f3cbd5c280d04249cee811d1dc478548975
Closes-Bug: #1286053

commit_message:
Added scaling parameters to HDP plugin config

Added SCALE_EXISTING_NG_COUNT and SCALE_NEW_NG_COUNT parameters to HDP plugin
config. The default behavior remains as before, but an additional option
is added. Cluster scaling is parameterized in order to add an ability
to re-use cluster scaling test in performance/benchmark testing.

Change-Id: Iba1570f978e4f44046e64f1d38b2f498e7a0c421

Currently there is no easy way to pass in enable ssl
and set the ssl options in keystone config. This
should expose the options to be set as part of
the ssl config in keystone.

commit_message:
Add argparse to requirements.txt

argparse is a requirement of os-refresh-config, so it should be listed here.
Likely this error is never encountered b/c argparse is part of python 2.7. But,
for older distros like RHEL that are still on python 2.6, it needs to know to
install it explicitly.

Change-Id: I63bd54bf42d99d2ef7f6534848afc396471cd802

subject: Adding rsync enablement support for Fedora
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-28 20:06:08.000000000', 'files': ['lib/swift'], 'message': "Adding rsync enablement support for Fedora

The actual way to enable rsync service is check if
is ubuntu, then enable it in /etc/default/rsync
if is not ubuntu, assume that's using xinetd.
However, Fedora is no longer using xinetd, it's
using systemd instead.
This patch check if it's fedora, if so, it uses
systemd to enable the service.

Change-Id: I83fedb91e0e3860c505927c526f8f0909cef5dfe
"}]
commit_message:
Adding rsync enablement support for Fedora

The actual way to enable rsync service is check if
is ubuntu, then enable it in /etc/default/rsync
if is not ubuntu, assume that's using xinetd.
However, Fedora is no longer using xinetd, it's
using systemd instead.
This patch check if it's fedora, if so, it uses
systemd to enable the service.

Change-Id: I83fedb91e0e3860c505927c526f8f0909cef5dfe

commit_message:
Revert "Fix security groups wadl"

The path is valid and works locally for me. Using http reference from the api-site to api-site is broken.

This reverts commit bd530142efecc3c11c65d0c90e75034b279871a1

commit_message:
Support preserve_ephemeral

Teach the PXE driver to preserve the ephemeral partition during deploy
(if requested).

The patch also improve the exception message for invalid parameter value
to include the bad value in it and the reason why it failed.

Docstrings of the deploy() and work_on_disk() functions were also updated
in this patch.

Based on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59312
          https://review.openstack.org/#/c/54308

blueprint: preserve-ephemeral
Partial-Bug: #1174154
Change-Id: I45f63cd3648eec6776d0716ac26f5be6862f7cfe

commit_message:
Make compute manager use Flavor object

This makes compute manager use the Flavor objects instead of a
raw conductor API to get information about flavors during resize.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: Ieb56b754eb5a4824fc69093897bdff25ab020883

commit_message:
Remove psutil dependency

The version of psutil that was being required is not hosted on
PyPi which caused some issues. This patch removes the psutil
dependency in favor of using the method that was proposed for
the havana backport of polling minimization.

Closes-bug: #1268711
Change-Id: I5a1672cfd195099d92578321153c42b8bfd09b7d

commit_message:
Upload docker images directly into glance

Instead of sending images into the docker registry,
upload them into Glance. This serves to increase code-reuse
as well as simplifying image caching as we progress toward
functional-test gating in Nova.

blueprint: docker-glance-uploads

Change-Id: I7a2d90f76487e2b4b9b2591035599a79600b73fb

commit_message:
Remove extraneous vim configuration comments for ironic

Remove vim setting:

comment - # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4

at the top of source code files, except for files in
openstack/common.

Change-Id: Ie80f76f08e27b7f5f747227c4cca8d79ad98bec6
Partial-Bug: #1229324

Validation of the names of the metadata is not implemented

commit_message:
Replace HTTPSConnection in bigswitch driver

Replace HTTPSConnection in bigswitch driver with Requests.

SSL Verification is from now on enabled by default.

This changes the default behaviour and is the primary intention of this
change: verify SSL certificates.

This might break existing configuration/setups where the SSL certificate
used by the bigswitch driver would not pass the verification.

SecurityImpact
DocImpact
Partial-Bug: 1188189

Change-Id: I10fbb706b34ca5e29d86c369d9e83d8518f24867

commit_message:
Adds unit test for etc/nova/policy.json data

* Test live etc/nova/policy.json data
* Convert all actions in policy.json to admin-only actions
* Check that Policy auth exception is raised when all above actions are
  called using non-admin context

commit_message:
Make the PXE driver understand ephemeral disks

Allows the PXE driver to create an ephemeral partition. This is the first
step in being able to redeploy a baremetal machine with a new image but
preserve the data on the ephemeral disk.

Based on Nova's patch: https://review.openstack.org/51735

blueprint: preserve-ephemeral
Closes-Bug: #1238311
Change-Id: I2826f1f8b60316ea180284cffc495a7556e31784

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-02-27 17:06:37.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/keystone_ldap_spec.rb', 'manifests/ldap.pp'], 'message': "LDAP: Add support for the ldap options

 - Add support for all the ldap related options, but
   ditched default values so that we won't get out of sync
   with keystone
 - Mark the LDAP password as secret
 - Add a package dependency that is required to make
   ldap functional
 - Since defaults are now undefined, define a few basic
   defaults and check them. Also ensure the package dep
   is set

Change-Id: Id13854d9407e65db7efc223f6d5335975a58ee5b
"}]
commit_message:
LDAP: Add support for the ldap options

 - Add support for all the ldap related options, but
   ditched default values so that we won't get out of sync
   with keystone
 - Mark the LDAP password as secret
 - Add a package dependency that is required to make
   ldap functional
 - Since defaults are now undefined, define a few basic
   defaults and check them. Also ensure the package dep
   is set

Change-Id: Id13854d9407e65db7efc223f6d5335975a58ee5b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 616, 'name': 'Mark Washenberger', 'email': 'mark.washenberger@markwash.net', 'username': 'markwash'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}, {'_account_id': 9236, 'name': 'Jon Bernard', 'email': 'jobernar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jbernard'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-31 18:56:02.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': "Only show progress bar for local image files

This patch fixes a bug where both 'location' and 'progress' are passed
as command line arguments.  In this case, the 'data' field is not
present in the fields dict and therefore the progress option cannot be
used.  A check is added to make sure the user has specified both a local
image file and the progress flag together.

Change-Id: Ia563139ee8b56d54d480534986e4b619a503fbfc
Closes-Bug: #1259357
"}]
commit_message:
Only show progress bar for local image files

This patch fixes a bug where both 'location' and 'progress' are passed
as command line arguments.  In this case, the 'data' field is not
present in the fields dict and therefore the progress option cannot be
used.  A check is added to make sure the user has specified both a local
image file and the progress flag together.

Change-Id: Ia563139ee8b56d54d480534986e4b619a503fbfc
Closes-Bug: #1259357

Add set-console-mode, get-console commands

Get connection information about the console and enable/disable the
console on the node.

Shows the console_enabled field in the node-show command.

commit_message:
Syncing policy engine from oslo-incubator

Syncing policy module - commit ba4d2ee
Including commit 0da5de6

$ python update.py --nodeps --base nova --dest-dir ../nova/ --modules policy

Adds the ability to check any resource's field against a constant
(literal, or string) in the policy.json file.

Change-Id: I54c8267c95e862e7ba5789a72ad353fdaf8514ad
Implements: blueprint policy-constant-check

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-02-27 21:32:17.000000000', 'files': ['rally/benchmark/runners/continuous.py', 'tests/benchmark/test_runner.py', 'rally/benchmark/validation.py', 'rally/benchmark/runners/periodic.py', 'tests/orchestrator/test_api.py', 'tests/benchmark/test_engine.py', 'tests/benchmark/runners/test_periodic.py', 'tests/benchmark/test_validation.py', 'rally/benchmark/engine.py', 'tests/benchmark/runners/test_continuous.py', 'rally/benchmark/runner.py'], 'message': 'Move scenario args validation to BenchmarkEngine

1. Move the scenario args validation process to the benchmark engine,
   just before the ScenarioRunner class gets instantiated.
2. Add support for different validation strategies:
    a) admin - run using admin clients;
    b) user - run using user clients:
        - In case of pre created users - run for all of them;
        - In case of tmp users - run only from one
          (that will be created specially for this case inside benchmark.engine)

The actual definition of the desired validation stragery should be done by the
@validation.requires_permission(...) decorator, which signals the BenchmarkEngine
which clients to pass to the validation method, e.g.:

    @validation.requires_permission(consts.EndpointPermission.ADMIN)
    def some_validator(clients, **kwargs):
        """BenchmarkEngine will guarantee that this validator gets supplied with
           an admin client; it will skip this validator if no admin client can be
           created."""

This patch also renames self.temp_users in ScenarioRunner and subclasses to just
self.users, thus reflecting the fact that the users may not be temporarily created
but passed to the ScenarioRunner as precreated ones.

Change-Id: I334e83fbc77d7cb014d96d43cadd673071286d14
'}]
commit_message:
Move scenario args validation to BenchmarkEngine

1. Move the scenario args validation process to the benchmark engine,
   just before the ScenarioRunner class gets instantiated.
2. Add support for different validation strategies:
    a) admin - run using admin clients;
    b) user - run using user clients:
        - In case of pre created users - run for all of them;
        - In case of tmp users - run only from one
          (that will be created specially for this case inside benchmark.engine)

The actual definition of the desired validation stragery should be done by the
@validation.requires_permission(...) decorator, which signals the BenchmarkEngine
which clients to pass to the validation method, e.g.:

    @validation.requires_permission(consts.EndpointPermission.ADMIN)
    def some_validator(clients, **kwargs):
        """BenchmarkEngine will guarantee that this validator gets supplied with
           an admin client; it will skip this validator if no admin client can be
           created."""

This patch also renames self.temp_users in ScenarioRunner and subclasses to just
self.users, thus reflecting the fact that the users may not be temporarily created
but passed to the ScenarioRunner as precreated ones.

Change-Id: I334e83fbc77d7cb014d96d43cadd673071286d14

The default glance_control_exchange in Ceilometer has been changed

commit_message:
Do not enforce glance_control_exchange

The default glance_control_exchange in Ceilometer has been changed
from 'glance_notifications' to 'glance' in grizzly-2. Glance always
had 'glance' for its control_exchange.

This was a bug in Ceilometer and puppet-ceilometer patched it.
It shouldn't anymore.

Change-Id: I217515c91f092fb3e8039dde2d14a7ab4cbb7245
Closes-bug: #1273878
(cherry picked from commit 85d46894cca6ba80e8cb57243dde57e44cffa443)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-17 16:09:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'message': "Remove admin auth when getting the list of Neutron API extensions.

Currently _refresh_neutron_extensions_cache() always authenticates
with Neutron using the configured Neutron admin credentials because
it doesn't have access to the calling context.  But it's actually
always called when a valid context exists, and the call to get the
list of extensions is not itself an admin operation.  By passing
the context down we can avoid this additional authentication step.

Change-Id: I9e7d9c5e424a6b39c8f8ee1c79f5fd8f48ad81a2
Closes-Bug: 1250850
"}]
commit_message:
Remove admin auth when getting the list of Neutron API extensions.

Currently _refresh_neutron_extensions_cache() always authenticates
with Neutron using the configured Neutron admin credentials because
it doesn't have access to the calling context.  But it's actually
always called when a valid context exists, and the call to get the
list of extensions is not itself an admin operation.  By passing
the context down we can avoid this additional authentication step.

Change-Id: I9e7d9c5e424a6b39c8f8ee1c79f5fd8f48ad81a2
Closes-Bug: 1250850

commit_message:
Add croniter dependency

A cron library, will be used in Ceilometer alarms.

License is MIT, lower bound is based on the added Py3 support.

Is also used by Mistral: https://github.com/stackforge/mistral/blob/master/requirements.txt

Change-Id: I9b818c171d9ca2e4e8afd8058769be471b2ff800
Blueprint: time-constrained-alarms

commit_message:
Remove cinder volume type deletion

Rally doesn't currently create cinder volume types, so shouldn't blindly
remove all existing types. Also the remove function doesn't actually
work.

Closes-Bug: #1286129

whereby the user can pass additional placement related information
into the Nova scheduler.

scheduler filters, and the set of hints which are supported on any system
therefore depends on the filters that have been configured (this could
include non-standard filters). It is not currently possible for a user
of the system to determine which hints are available. Hints that are not
supported will be silently ignored by the scheduler

by querying each of the configured scheduler filters

In the v3 API this feature is added to the os-scheduler-hints plugin

Change-Id: I3e88c75d37ea5c00285c47d05efa3c551d2006ef
'}]
commit_message:
API extension to list supported scheduler hints

The Nova API for instance creation supports a scheduler_hints mechanism
whereby the user can pass additional placement related information
into the Nova scheduler.

The implementation of scheduler_hints lies (mostly) in the various
scheduler filters, and the set of hints which are supported on any system
therefore depends on the filters that have been configured (this could
include non-standard filters). It is not currently possible for a user
of the system to determine which hints are available. Hints that are not
supported will be silently ignored by the scheduler

This API extension makes the list of supported hints available to users
by querying each of the configured scheduler filters

In the v3 API this feature is added to the os-scheduler-hints plugin

DocImpact

Implements blueprint scheduler-hints-api

Change-Id: I3e88c75d37ea5c00285c47d05efa3c551d2006ef

commit_message:
make the --pass argument to user-create required

also rearranges the arguments so the required arguments come first
i.e.

usage: keystone user-create --name <user-name> --pass [<pass>]
                            [--tenant <tenant>] [--email <email>]
                            [--enabled <true|false>]

vs. the old:

usage: keystone user-create --name <user-name> [--tenant <tenant>] --pass
                            [<pass>] [--email <email>]
                            [--enabled <true|false>]

Change-Id: I9d558a413c84f80a1883a7692c502ef6e2424c52
Closes-Bug: #1286202

commit_message:
Remove duplications from hadoop elements

Since java and ssh became the own elements
we should remove duplications and add them as dependencies
for hadoop and hadoop-cdh elements

Also savanna-version element was added as dependency for hadoop-hdp

Change-Id: I73e6865f44964910c22a12e52731368834334a7e

subject: Don't create empty secret_key_path file
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 26, 'name': 'Matt Ray', 'email': 'matthewhray@gmail.com', 'username': 'mattray'}, {'_account_id': 1032, 'name': 'Justin Shepherd', 'email': 'jshepher@rackspace.com', 'username': 'jshepher'}, {'_account_id': 6526, 'name': 'David Geng', 'email': 'gengjh@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'genggjh'}, {'_account_id': 7307, 'name': 'Matt Thompson', 'email': 'mattt@defunct.ca', 'username': 'mattt416'}, {'_account_id': 9884, 'name': 'Wherenow.org CI', 'email': 'jenkins@wherenow.org', 'username': 'wherenowjenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-26 14:02:24.000000000', 'files': ['spec/server-redhat_spec.rb', 'spec/server-suse_spec.rb', 'spec/server_spec.rb', 'recipes/server.rb'], 'message': "Don't create empty secret_key_path file

Currently, the file resource will create a secret_key_path even if
secret_key_content is nil (due to default action of create).  This
change adds some protection so that we effectively only manage
file perms/ownership when secret_key_content is unset.

If secret_key_content is nil (default), the dashboard itself will
create secret_key_path and populate it.

Change-Id: Id7bff6a82eba1e80bf9883db3c45ba06edde2d91
Closes-bug: #1285125
"}]
commit_message:
Don't create empty secret_key_path file

Currently, the file resource will create a secret_key_path even if
secret_key_content is nil (due to default action of create).  This
change adds some protection so that we effectively only manage
file perms/ownership when secret_key_content is unset.

If secret_key_content is nil (default), the dashboard itself will
create secret_key_path and populate it.

Change-Id: Id7bff6a82eba1e80bf9883db3c45ba06edde2d91
Closes-bug: #1285125

commit_message:
Prefix private methods with _ in docker driver

Private methods should be prefixed with a _ for
clarity. Although most private methods were
marked this way, a few were not.

Renames and marks private:
 is_daemon_running
 find_container_by_name
 get_available_resource

Closes-Bug: #1267664

Change-Id: Ifc6818b7620af972cc0eec6f9ef43610456895f1

The puppet-swift modules emit deprecation warnings of the form:

Warning: Variable access via 'pipeline' is deprecated. Use
  '@pipeline' instead. template[inline]:2
   (at (erb):2:in `result')

These are due to missing @ signs in inline ERB templates in

(cherry picked from commit edd25ce6b30304705f9168e5c091fb2611d9cc7b)

commit_message:
Fix deprecation warnings in inline templates

The puppet-swift modules emit deprecation warnings of the form:

Warning: Variable access via 'pipeline' is deprecated. Use
  '@pipeline' instead. template[inline]:2
   (at (erb):2:in `result')

These are due to missing @ signs in inline ERB templates in
storage/server.pp and proxy.pp.  This patch fixes them.

Change-Id: I3745cfd86c4332f00bc10a0999088691b3833147
Closes-Bug: #1282717
(cherry picked from commit edd25ce6b30304705f9168e5c091fb2611d9cc7b)

commit_message:
Call get_pgsql_connection_info from _test_postgresql_opportunistically

The _test_postgresql_opportunistically method was calling the method to
parse the mysql connection URL which is wrong when there is one
specifically for postgresql, so call the right method.

This wasn't causing issues obviously but is something that needs to be
cleaned up regardless.

Closes-Bug: #1274718

Change-Id: Ic572e612c7ce31d854dc7258aa9c8b89a197260e

commit_message:
unskip test_security_group_rules_negative tests

Neutron validates the uuid format as nova the integer format,
 so if we want 404 for non existent, resource we need to use a valid uuid.

Change-Id: I80f5b9a8f2bc75f8b9c3ba753070ee6f5ea44f5e

commit_message:
Sort requirement files in alphabetical order

This makes code more readable, and can check whether specific library
in the requirement files easily. We enforce the check in pep8, We also
add the tools for checking requirements.txt and test_requirements.txt.

Closes-Bug: #1285478
