subject: Fix changes-since filter for list-servers API
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1678, 'name': 'Tiantian Gao', 'email': 'gtt116@gmail.com', 'username': 'gtt116'}, {'_account_id': 1812, 'name': 'p-draigbrady', 'email': 'P@draigBrady.com', 'username': 'p-draigbrady'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-13 10:35:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Fix changes-since filter for list-servers API

On list-servers API, "changes-since" parameter filters out servers
which have been created at the same date as the specified timestamp.
For example, the following server is filtered out with "changes-since=
2013-12-05T15:03:25":

  mysql> select display_name, updated_at from instances;
  +--------------+---------------------+
  | display_name | updated_at          |
  +--------------+---------------------+
  | vm01         | 2013-12-05 15:03:25 |
  +--------------+---------------------+

This bug causes some Tempest test failures, if the timestamp of server
creations are the same as the "changes-since" timestamp in second unit.
In addition, the behavior would be wrong from the viewpoint of its name
which includes "since".

This patch chanegs the server list for including the ones created at
the specified timestamp.

Change-Id: Icc10a1363503b3553d810c6be20b86b3da7ac1a0
Closes-Bug: #1236585
(cherry picked from commit d87bd44d0211a633efd545dc7b2027a613897b85)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix changes-since filter for list-servers API

On list-servers API, "changes-since" parameter filters out servers
which have been created at the same date as the specified timestamp.
For example, the following server is filtered out with "changes-since=
2013-12-05T15:03:25":

  mysql> select display_name, updated_at from instances;
  +--------------+---------------------+
  | display_name | updated_at          |
  +--------------+---------------------+
  | vm01         | 2013-12-05 15:03:25 |
  +--------------+---------------------+

This bug causes some Tempest test failures, if the timestamp of server
creations are the same as the "changes-since" timestamp in second unit.
In addition, the behavior would be wrong from the viewpoint of its name
which includes "since".

This patch chanegs the server list for including the ones created at
the specified timestamp.

Change-Id: Icc10a1363503b3553d810c6be20b86b3da7ac1a0
Closes-Bug: #1236585
(cherry picked from commit d87bd44d0211a633efd545dc7b2027a613897b85)

commit_message:
VMware storage backend should use oslo.vmware

Currently, the VMware store is using its own copy of the
VMwareApiSession to connect to vCenter server and ESX(i).
This patch gets rid of this copy to use the oslo.vmware library.

Closes-Bug: #1282715

Change-Id: I0aa47eada388c09d9835b00fb2c93f50f22675a4

commit_message:
Fix 031 migration failed on DB2

031 migration script failed on DB2, because DB2 doesn't support
GROUP BY with clob data type.
Add if condition to judge DB2 connection, if yes, make another sql query
supported by DB2.

Fixes bug #1256816

Change-Id: I7e3a8cd89edd91c167c619365ab863ec53787f8f

commit_message:
Add use task subcommand

Added a new subcommand in use command: 'rally use task <task_id>'
which sets a RALLY_TASK global var in ~/.rally/use_command
Hence the user does not need to specify a task UUID in commands
requiring this parameter.

Partially implements blueprint: use-task-subcommand

Change-Id: I51fffa017c56321493d1a5eba866d7163b9fc813

subject: Fix CIDR key error bug
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-28 13:19:13.000000000', 'files': ['rally/benchmark/utils.py', 'tests/fakes.py'], 'message': 'Fix CIDR key error bug

The nova.security_groups.create() requires the cidr in the following
format: cidr="0.0.0.0/0", however when the the rule is listed as part of
a security group, it is returned as "ip_range": {"cidr": "0.0.0.0/0"}.

This patch ajdusts fakes to replicate this behaviour so that the tests
can be fixed. Also adjusts the criteria in the rules_to_add dictionary
to be correct.

Change-Id: Ifaa0e92fdc240e4aea114c062632c5fe539e7921
Closes-Bug: #1286096
'}]
commit_message:
Fix CIDR key error bug

The nova.security_groups.create() requires the cidr in the following
format: cidr="0.0.0.0/0", however when the the rule is listed as part of
a security group, it is returned as "ip_range": {"cidr": "0.0.0.0/0"}.

This patch ajdusts fakes to replicate this behaviour so that the tests
can be fixed. Also adjusts the criteria in the rules_to_add dictionary
to be correct.

Change-Id: Ifaa0e92fdc240e4aea114c062632c5fe539e7921
Closes-Bug: #1286096

commit_message:
Added hardware agent's inspector and snmp implementation

Added the inspector interface to hardware agent, also added the snmp
implementation of that inspector.

Implements: blueprint monitoring-physical-devices

Based on the original code at https://github.com/graflu0/ceilometer
contributed by Lucas and Toni.

Change-Id: I7cbaf94d72d389dc802c42b6ca8939b81a1d6b10
Signed-off-by: Lucas Graf <graflu0@students.zhaw.ch>
Signed-off-by: Toni Zehnder <zehndton@students.zhaw.ch>

commit_message:
Remove uuidutils imports in oslo modules

The only use of uuidutils in oslo-incubator is generate_uuid
which could be replaced with uuid.uuid4().
Droping the dependency would help deprecating/removing uuidutils
in the future.

Change-Id: I2b6a8cfa37493ee174da44e18d30d2951aaaf454
Partial-bug: #1253497

The error notifications sent by wrap_exception are a good source of
information when tracking down errors in the system. It is easy to spot
patterns in the errors by looking at similarities in the exceptions
raised.

This change looks at making the in-line error notifications
follow the same format, so they become equally useful.

Closes-Bug: #1251602
Change-Id: I1cd64a90ecefc64d12af05487eb6e45aa0362d69
'}]
commit_message:
Make error notifications more consistent.

The error notifications sent by wrap_exception are a good source of
information when tracking down errors in the system. It is easy to spot
patterns in the errors by looking at similarities in the exceptions
raised.

This change looks at making the in-line error notifications
follow the same format, so they become equally useful.

Closes-Bug: #1251602
Change-Id: I1cd64a90ecefc64d12af05487eb6e45aa0362d69

commit_message:
Added hardware pollsters for the central agent

This patch added various pollsters for the hardware agent.

Implements: blueprint monitoring-physical-devices

Based on the original code at https://github.com/graflu0/ceilometer
contributed by Lucas and Toni.

Signed-off-by: Lucas Graf <graflu0@students.zhaw.ch>
Signed-off-by: Toni Zehnder <zehndton@students.zhaw.ch>
Signed-off-by: Lianhao Lu <lianhao.lu@intel.com>

Change-Id: Id259b95efdbf0b7d03b657586d588f9637d9a367

commit_message:
Expand get_file using to template scope

So we can use get_file in outputs section and parameters section
except resources section. For example, we can use get_file to set
default value for some parameters.

Change-Id: If584ea108b437c28713925af68691c019e64e1fc

commit_message:
Ensure that the NoCloud data source is loaded

Add NoCloud to CentOS cloud.cfg data sources and remove /var/lib/cloud
before re-creating it to ensure that everything is re-run.

Closes-Bug: #1285891

commit_message:
Fix neutron-lbaas-agent issue

Currently, you cannot converge a CentOS (and presumably SUSE) node when
balancer recipe is in run list.  This is because no neutron_lb_packages
attributes have been specified.

Change-Id: I4d3428c69c7e6098b13aa15bf07e61defdc2a207
Closes-Bug: #1283237

commit_message:
Remove use of uuidutils.generate_uuid

Oslo is removing uuidutils.generate_uuid() during the icehouse cycle.
This patch moves generate_uuid to designate.utils.

Change-Id: I65c6d8e0d985c67f43682e9f3ae80997ee96d0f7

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1994, 'name': 'Zhongyue Luo', 'email': 'zhongyue.luo@gmail.com', 'username': 'zyluo'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 4458, 'name': 'Shane Wang', 'email': 'shane.wang@intel.com', 'username': 'shane-wang'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7641, 'name': 'Shuangtai Tian', 'email': 'hitianst@gmail.com', 'username': 'shuangtai'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-26 17:22:39.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/policy.py', 'tests/unit/test_policy.py'], 'message': 'Adds a flag to determine whether to reload the rules in policy

Initing a Enforcer class with rules can not set rules,  because the policy
file is modified , the load_rules always try to load the rules from the cache
or config file when checks the policy. This patch adds a flag to determine
whether to reload the rules from policy file.

Closes-Bug: #1279198

Change-Id: Ife84189be4b86a3ee90da4539ff2dbed125be23d
'}]
commit_message:
Adds a flag to determine whether to reload the rules in policy

Initing a Enforcer class with rules can not set rules,  because the policy
file is modified , the load_rules always try to load the rules from the cache
or config file when checks the policy. This patch adds a flag to determine
whether to reload the rules from policy file.

Closes-Bug: #1279198

Change-Id: Ife84189be4b86a3ee90da4539ff2dbed125be23d

commit_message:
Use mock.call_count to assert the call counter

In patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/65424 , the unit test for
test_base_filter.py is not using mock.call_count to identify the
call counter.

This patch was using call_count to check that the filter was only
called once.

Change-Id: I792c894c0414d11ab7461b6e5cc9366ced787ebb

commit_message:
Remove README from openstack/common

openstack/common should only include files from oslo-incubator now.
Assume every one understand that can't modify these files in openstack/common
directly. So remove the file README.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-03 13:34:49.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_health/tests/platform_tests/test_platform_murano_linux.py'], 'message': 'Add self.fail for telnet and apache murano tests

Deployed Murano for now do not support deployment
without pre-defined keypare for telnet and apache services
So this tests will be fail until Murano is updated.
So add self.fail in SetUp() for this tests that
do not wait and initialize objects for failed tests

Also fixed flake8 issues for test_platform_murano_linux.py

Change-Id: Ibf18339830b13618670d891c642c4bcfeb3376c4
Closes-bug: #1275710
'}]
commit_message:
Add self.fail for telnet and apache murano tests

Deployed Murano for now do not support deployment
without pre-defined keypare for telnet and apache services
So this tests will be fail until Murano is updated.
So add self.fail in SetUp() for this tests that
do not wait and initialize objects for failed tests

Also fixed flake8 issues for test_platform_murano_linux.py

Change-Id: Ibf18339830b13618670d891c642c4bcfeb3376c4
Closes-bug: #1275710

commit_message:
Adding ChefSpec Custom Matchers for register LWRP

Replaced all lwrp testing in spec/registration_spec.rb with testing via
custom matchers. Also added test for :service_create call in
recipes/registration.rb.

Change-Id: I877b3f5b48fe5b85d9b7825ce5c20e16b157d531
Closes-Bug: #1253016
Addresses: blueprint chefspec-lwrp-for-identity

commit_message:
Add timeout for waiting callback from deploy ramdisk

'callback_timeout' options added to conductor, if timeout reached
node switched to error state. New periodical task created for timeouts
check.

Related-Bug: #1270986
Change-Id: I3084d529baa13d4f848a7d050b8299582a28d7e9

commit_message:
Debian: fix package and service names

In previous commits, Neutron Metering and VPNaaS agents services and
packages names have been modified to support Ubuntu, in breaking Debian
support.
This patch aims to fix it.

Change-Id: Iff9f8a925bca8534fe6672c3ab84513aa0416cd5
Partial-Bug: #1284179
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Optimize filters and weights

This change caches configuration, and reduces logging, to speed up the
operation of the scheduler.

Using the default configuration, with 200 hosts, performed by running
test_caching_scheduler as a script, showed these optimizations to take
the per schedule time down from near 20ms to under 4ms.

This means the time taken to process 1000 schedule requests, with the
caching scheduler, has been reduced to under 4 seconds, from 20 seconds.

Part of blueprint caching-scheduler
Change-Id: I555804fcc6a724364242a349f079704f07497250

commit_message:
Fix IPAddress and CIDR type decorators

Use load_dialect_impl() user hook instead of calling
with_variant() on a type implementation in IPAddress
and CIDR type decorators. This makes this code work
with SQLAlchemy 0.8.x versions.

Fixes bug 1200231

Change-Id: Ib0eb582f472116bda817d3e35e26888dc116ad58
(cherry picked from commit cd382933eb5b6b09f34398cf2c963164bc5b6fc7)

subject: Stop devtest if user was not in libvirtd group
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7419, 'name': 'Imre Farkas', 'email': 'farkas.imre@gmail.com', 'username': 'ifarkas'}, {'_account_id': 8532, 'name': 'Ryan Brady', 'email': 'rbrady@redhat.com', 'username': 'rbrady'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-27 18:24:39.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/install-dependencies'], 'message': "Stop devtest if user was not in libvirtd group

The current mechanism for picking up the new group doesn't work
correctly anyway (see bug report for a full example of the current
behavior), and it's more friendly to stop immediately and let the
user know what they need to do instead of continuing on and
failing, which buries the relevant message further up the
scrollback.

Change-Id: I94bdb331567b92b572953d839605ed4c2108e8ec
Closes-Bug: 1285285
"}]
commit_message:
Stop devtest if user was not in libvirtd group

The current mechanism for picking up the new group doesn't work
correctly anyway (see bug report for a full example of the current
behavior), and it's more friendly to stop immediately and let the
user know what they need to do instead of continuing on and
failing, which buries the relevant message further up the
scrollback.

Change-Id: I94bdb331567b92b572953d839605ed4c2108e8ec
Closes-Bug: 1285285

commit_message:
Use uuid instead of uuidutils

The generate_uuid() functions will be deprecated/removed from uuidutils/
This patch replaces uuidutils.generate_uuid() with str(uuid.uuid4()).

Change-Id: I40e2dbf5e9e04b0109b1185df70e4f4ba93a17c9
Partial-Bug: #1253497

commit_message:
Remove apps from settings

Those lines are supposed to be replaced by their
counterparts in openstack_dashboard/enabled
and not used any more here. It's a leftover
and was forgotten to remove in
blueprint plugin-architecture

Implements blueprint plugin-architecture

Change-Id: I88ed5886304673391074f1cb681554a9288985e8

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-02-25 10:32:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/loadbalancer/loadbalancer_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/loadbalancer/drivers/test_agent_driver_base.py', 'neutron/services/loadbalancer/plugin.py', 'neutron/extensions/loadbalancer.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/loadbalancer/test_db_loadbalancer.py'], 'message': 'LBaaS: check for associations before deleting health monitor

Need to prohibit health monitor deletion if it has associations with
pools. Given that pools may belong to different lbaas drivers the process
of monitor deletion becomes complex and unreliable since association
deletion may fail on any single driver.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1243129
Change-Id: I27c20e7a5be8433f90569534ecf838e33027cb00
'}]
commit_message:
LBaaS: check for associations before deleting health monitor

Need to prohibit health monitor deletion if it has associations with
pools. Given that pools may belong to different lbaas drivers the process
of monitor deletion becomes complex and unreliable since association
deletion may fail on any single driver.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1243129
Change-Id: I27c20e7a5be8433f90569534ecf838e33027cb00

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-25 06:04:57.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_delete_server.py', 'tempest/api/compute/v3/servers/test_delete_server.py'], 'message': 'Check server terminations on "delete server" tests

Current "delete server" tests check the API response code only
and do not check server terminations. In current tests, Tempest
cannot detect the termination errors even if they happen.
This patch adds the checks for these tests.

Change-Id: Ib9ba09e86819d7f1027c90cf3ca98dee350125e8
'}]
commit_message:
Check server terminations on "delete server" tests

Current "delete server" tests check the API response code only
and do not check server terminations. In current tests, Tempest
cannot detect the termination errors even if they happen.
This patch adds the checks for these tests.

Change-Id: Ib9ba09e86819d7f1027c90cf3ca98dee350125e8

commit_message:
Nova V2 APIs for Domain Quota Management

V2 APIs in Nova for using Domain Quota Driver to manage the quotas at domain, project and user level.
These APIs will enable Nova to enforce domain quotas. These APIs are implemented using new extension
domain-quota-sets

Change-Id: I6aecf0723ce68cf507358ec872dedd2e07f47e4f
Implements: blueprint domain-quota-driver-api

Added the ability to configure additional cinder options for allocating
the over-subscription ratio and for setting the max disk use ratio.

subject: Add support for custom libvirt uri
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 7411, 'name': 'Matt Wagner', 'email': 'matt.wagner@redhat.com', 'username': 'matty_dubs'}, {'_account_id': 7419, 'name': 'Imre Farkas', 'email': 'farkas.imre@gmail.com', 'username': 'ifarkas'}, {'_account_id': 7711, 'name': 'Yuriy Zveryanskyy', 'email': 'yzveryanskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'yuriyz'}, {'_account_id': 8106, 'name': 'Haomeng,Wang', 'email': 'wanghaomeng@gmail.com', 'username': 'whaom'}, {'_account_id': 8125, 'name': 'Michael Davies', 'email': 'michael@the-davies.net', 'username': 'mrda'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-02-26 16:07:52.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/drivers/test_ssh.py', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ssh.py'], 'message': 'Add support for custom libvirt uri

SSH driver executes "virsh list --all" without setting the default
libvirt uri. It can cause issues eg. on Fedora where the default uri is
"qemu:///session" instead of "qemu:///system" and as a result it doesn't
find any domain. This patch adds support for setting libvirt uri.

Change-Id: If714913c8b41097f25026afabbb88aa90c496d81
Closes-bug: #1281025
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for custom libvirt uri

SSH driver executes "virsh list --all" without setting the default
libvirt uri. It can cause issues eg. on Fedora where the default uri is
"qemu:///session" instead of "qemu:///system" and as a result it doesn't
find any domain. This patch adds support for setting libvirt uri.

Change-Id: If714913c8b41097f25026afabbb88aa90c496d81
Closes-bug: #1281025

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-19 15:23:16.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/glance.rb'], 'message': 'Use remove_warnings from puppet-keystone

Glance client is getting the same warnings as Keystone client,
hence puppet-glance should use the same hack as puppet-keystone
until providers will be refactored to use API calls instead.

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1043725 for more details

Change-Id: I99e4308d0731307c019ad6cab8db5feee1b0ed73
(cherry picked from commit 9bc8d08681d6fdf1bbe682625ea9500118f21e3b)
'}]
commit_message:
Use remove_warnings from puppet-keystone

Glance client is getting the same warnings as Keystone client,
hence puppet-glance should use the same hack as puppet-keystone
until providers will be refactored to use API calls instead.

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1043725 for more details

Change-Id: I99e4308d0731307c019ad6cab8db5feee1b0ed73
(cherry picked from commit 9bc8d08681d6fdf1bbe682625ea9500118f21e3b)

commit_message:
Check that 'heat_template_version' is a HOT version

Previously, any value could be specified as the 'heat_template_version'.
Check that 'heat_template_version' is a valid HOT version and raise a
ValueError if it is not.

Change-Id: I7f9a7acd52cf6273a4730091c08b8cd1a5e07961
Closes-Bug: #1277215

commit_message:
Python 3: replace "im_self" by "__self__"

The Python 3 removed the "im_self" attribute and only supports the
"__self__". This patch replaces "im_self" by "__self__" attribute.

Closes-Bug: #1282514
Change-Id: Ib017fff4b720a5dd7ee27fd01b36a531d9b6ca9c

commit_message:
Add support for RC milestone creation

RC milestones need to use a specific code name ("RC1"). This change
makes sure create_milestones.py sets the right code name for RC
milestone creation.

Also fixes wrong comment on the sample yaml file.

Change-Id: Ie8e7b5942a02706c7c2b03c2d680c23ae85edef6

commit_message:
Refactoring metadata/base

- Extracted out methods from get_openstack_item for handling version, content and path
- Replaced the if else style route configuration with a route configuration dict
- This will help adding new apis easier and be maintainable

Change-Id: Ie1885c439f3d119032dd1c7c7af070142987ba7f
Partially implements: blueprint metadata-service-callbacks

commit_message:
Cleanup _interface class variables in compute/v3

We've already removed xml interface from Nova V3 APIs. So we can assume
the default is json. This commit sets _interface = 'json' to
BaseV3ComputeTest class and removes redundancy.

Change-Id: Ie9ad2242d20ce90fca74ca7a5390e0971f830caa

commit_message:
Prevent GET /v1/nodes returning maintenance field

GET /v1/nodes shouldn't return internal fields such as
'maintenance'.  Remove this field from the dictionary
returned, and test to make sure it doesn't come back.

Change-Id: I62b2be62ca2ca30c3fd63a1d9fe643b01fc4f171
Closes-Bug: #1282517

commit_message:
Move ipminative _set_boot_device to VendorPassthru

_set_boot_device must be exposed via vendor_passthru, allowing
operators to manually change it, and force to boot from net when
performing a pxe deploy.
Until now, it was just a private method of the power driver.

Change-Id: Iac3a7183db4c3486bd6a2aa1ba36bf33e11722a9
Partial-Bug: #1264596

commit_message:
Do not allow POST ports and chassis internal attributes

Some attributes of this resources should only be exposed to user without
possibility of set/modify. This patch uses 'readonly' parameter of
WSME 0.6 for prohibit these attributes in POST.

Change-Id: Idb4f39af04dfba58f90283db5b029deab14735cb

Some attributes of node should only be exposed to user without
possibility of set/modify. This patch uses 'readonly' parameter
of WSME 0.6 for prohibit these attributes in POST.

commit_message:
Removing get_node_power_state, bumping RPC version

There is a periodic task that is used to check the power state and save it to
the DB. Users can query the DB instead of checking the machine. Also removing
the RPC call and bumping RPC_API_VERSION to 1.10.

Closes-Bug: #1277062
Change-Id: I87923eee8f88e85e621fd0bf839d99250788561f

Currently 2 external (file) locks with different name
are created to protect image concurrent access for libvirt driver.
This may lead to image corruption in rare case. This patch change
the lock file name from nova-_var_lib_nova_instances_base_xxxx

'}]
commit_message:
Fix cache lock for image not consistent

Currently 2 external (file) locks with different name
are created to protect image concurrent access for libvirt driver.
This may lead to image corruption in rare case. This patch change
the lock file name from nova-_var_lib_nova_instances_base_xxxx
to nova-xxxx to make the lock name consistent

Change-Id: I3e60c3bcf456d2392409aa56ba05f4ad8fdc0444
Closes-Bug: #1265452

commit_message:
Restrict rootwrap find filter for NetAppNFS driver

Additional make the name of the filter unique, so it does not override
any other rule. Like the find rule of the GPFS driver.
Rootwrap is making use of plain python ConfigParser which handles INI files
with key=value pair like fashion. Where the key is unique.

Closes-Bug: 1250101

Change-Id: Id2f193485089e12f00008b38fad2b95a09674ff2

subject: Ensures NetApp iSCSI driver correctly compares int values for size
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 9366, 'name': 'Andrew Kerr', 'email': 'andrew.kerr@netapp.com', 'username': 'andrew-kerr'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-21 09:44:44.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/iscsi.py'], 'message': 'Ensures NetApp iSCSI driver correctly compares int values for size

The NetApp iSCSI driver needs to verify that the new size requested
during an extend operation does not exceed the max_resize of the
lun.  However, the driver was doing a >= compare against str values
of the sizes rather than the int values.  This caused the incorrect
code path to be used in certain situations.

Change-Id: I8bc66c71db6b469c7adf00ce8b5091513fccb740
Closes-Bug: 1281279
(cherry picked from commit a1d78df1b7c95dbb5024023662932cd94313dd58)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensures NetApp iSCSI driver correctly compares int values for size

The NetApp iSCSI driver needs to verify that the new size requested
during an extend operation does not exceed the max_resize of the
lun.  However, the driver was doing a >= compare against str values
of the sizes rather than the int values.  This caused the incorrect
code path to be used in certain situations.

Change-Id: I8bc66c71db6b469c7adf00ce8b5091513fccb740
Closes-Bug: 1281279
(cherry picked from commit a1d78df1b7c95dbb5024023662932cd94313dd58)

commit_message:
Restrict the length of the Security Group name input

There is an allowed maximum length for security group name field, but in
current code, it doesn't check or restrict that from UI side, i.e. user
will be able to type in more than what is allowed. After form
submission, it will fail but there is no clear message telling user what
caused failure.

After adding the code to restrict the max length of the security group
name field, user will not be able to input more than what is allowed,
thus this error will be prevented from UI.

Change-Id: I0f560e78e67a0259343f1a2c820270506653b254
Closes-Bug: #1279472

commit_message:
Fix volume stats with multiple LeftHand clusters

When more than one cluster exists in a LeftHand management
group, get_volume_stats may return the stats for the wrong
cluster. This patch fixes the problem by listing the cluster
name in the getClusterInfo query.

Change-Id: I2d5a76869c6bb1b3d514f0546ea00998e5ee32fb
Closes-Bug: #1279897

commit_message:
make service_check fatal

if we fail service check, we should do so in a fatal way, because
something is not right. This will be very useful in grenade.

Change-Id: I18811b0d8e6d06f364685c366cdc8f5dda3b8f7e

commit_message:
Fix Neutron enabled check

* Remove the check for neutron enabled on a block of variable settings, there
  is no conflict and serves no purpose.
* Also floating_ips.sh and volume.sh needed to properly source lib/neutron
  for do ping_check() to work properly.

The current error in check-devstack-dsvm-neutron is not related to this fix.

Change-Id: I1c458aaa787ffb98c945aefc3afa80c6861a405f
